paragraphs.text: Ferguson unrest: Make protesters pay for riot damage.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: No matter whose side you are on in the upheaval following the killing of Michael Brown by police officer Darren Wilson in Ferguson, Missouri, everyone should agree on the profound sadness of it all: sadness that an 18-year-old boy-man walked a path that led to his destruction; sadness that a police officer felt the need to defend himself by shooting another human being; sadness over the rioting and looting that followed a grand jury's decision not to indict Officer Wilson; and for some, sadness that Wilson was not indicted
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Much of the sadness was encapsulated in a sound bite I saw on one TV network
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: An African-American business owner, surveying the destruction of his store, plaintively asked,"How am I going to feed my kids?"

paragraphs.text: Restitution is an Old Testament concept instituted to remind people that when one harms another person, or steals or destroys property, someone else suffers and deserves reimbursement

paragraphs.text: It says the state is less a debtor than the victim of a crime
